info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 21 at 11:26AM EDT until April 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan...
Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County.
.Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt are occurring.
* WHERE...Chocolay River near Harvey.
* WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate the parking lot where M-28 crosses the Chocolay River...as well as low lying areas along Timber Lane and towards the mouth of the river
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued 1200 PM EDT Tuesday.Tuesday afternoon at noon EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING
